meanings.sent1: The whistlers in the park entertained everyone with their tunes.
meanings.sent2: I heard a whistler walking down the street this morning.
meanings.sent3: The whistlers at the talent show were quite impressive.
meanings.sent4: The whistlers in the choir harmonized beautifully.
meanings.sent5: The whistlers in the band added a cheerful touch to the music.

meanings.definition: A high-pitched sound made by whistling.
meanings.sent1: The whistlers of the wind through the trees created a soothing melody.
meanings.sent2: The whistlers of the kettle signaled that the water was boiling.
meanings.sent3: The whistlers of the teapot made the cat curious.
meanings.sent4: The whistlers of the train passing by echoed in the valley.
meanings.sent5: The whistlers of the birds in the morning filled the air with music.

meanings.definition: A type of bird known for its melodious song.
meanings.sent1: The whistlers in the forest sang a sweet serenade.
meanings.sent2: I spotted a whistler perched on the branch, chirping happily.
meanings.sent3: The whistlers in the garden seemed to be having a conversation.
meanings.sent4: The whistlers in the sky painted a picture of tranquility.
meanings.sent5: The whistlers in the meadow greeted the dawn with their cheerful tunes.
